New Records: Freddie Freeman homered four times in the series, tying the Yankees' Bobby Richardson for the World Series record.
Key Match Events: Aaron Judge dropped a routine fly ball in the fifth inning.
Freddie Freeman's two-run single in the Dodgers' five-run fifth gave him 12 RBIs in the series, tying the Yankees' Bobby Richardson for the World Series record.
Teoscar Hern√°ndez's double in the eighth inning tied the game for the Dodgers.
Mookie Betts hit a sacrifice fly in the eighth inning, ensuring the Dodgers would not lose the series 3-0.
Blake Treinen threw a season-high 42 pitches and gave the Dodgers 2 1/3 scoreless innings in the eighth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts praised Blake Treinen for his performance in the eighth inning.
Aaron Boone, Yankees manager, expressed heartbreak over the loss.
Aaron Judge admitted the Yankees defense melted down in the fifth inning.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees authored a dream start to Game 5 with Judge hitting the first pitch for a two-run home run.
Jack Flaherty, the Dodgers' starter, lasted just four outs before departing.
Gerrit Cole continued into the seventh inning despite the Yankees' five-run lead in the fifth.
Tommy Kahnle's performance in the sixth and seventh innings contributed to the Yankees' loss.
